page.title: 03Fishing boat_The Carvida
page.content: The Carvida travels out 200 miles N.E.of Fraserburgh to their fishing grounds. They have to stay within 3 miles of the harbour because that is their territorial waters.They stay out for up to 10 days before they come in and land their fish.The Carvida has radars,echo sounders, VHFs,2 Deccas and charts to help them.It can go on automatic pilot but if it is bad weather they just use the wheel to steer.All boats do not travel to the same area but the bigger ones do. The Carvida is 80 feet long and it is a wooden boat,6 years old.It has 9 beds,a shower and a toilet. It is a red and gold boat and it has a black stone engine. The skipper has had 3 boats,2 called"Golden Promise"and the "Carvida".He started fishing when he was fifteen.
